casebody.data:
Benjamin PROSS, Plaintiff in Error, v. UNITED STATES, Defendant in Error. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. June 3, 1929. No. 369. Archibald Palmer, of New York City (Chauncey Hanan Levy, of New York City, oh the brief), for plaintiff in error. Howard W. Ameli, U. S. Atty., of Brooklyn, N. Y. (Herbert H. Kellogg, Asst. U. S. Atty., of Brooklyn, N. Y., and Morris E. Packer, Asst. U. S. Atty., of New York City, of counsel), for the United States.

Before MANTON, L. HAND, and CHASE, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed.
